title: Relative Clauses - 2
instructions: Complete the sentences with the appropriate relative pronoun, B1whichB2 or B1whatB2.

remarks: Corr: what. Here 'what' comes immediately after the noun 'written down', so there's no noun before to refer back to.

sentence: He didn't believe that there is a car
remarks: Corr: which. We need 'which' to refer back to a noun 'car'. We cannot use 'what' to refer to nouns.

sentence: grow in this forest are very rare.
remarks: Corr: which. Here we need 'which' to refer back to 'trees'. We cannot use 'what' to refer back to nouns.
Corr: what. Here 'what' comes immediately after the verb 'drank', so there's no noun to refer back to.
Corr: what. Here 'what' comes immediately after the verb 'understand', so there's no noun to refer back to.
Corr: which. We need 'which' to refer back to a noun 'company'. We cannot use 'what' to refer back to nouns.
Corr: what. Here 'what' comes immediately after the verb 'suspected'. There's no noun to refer back to.
Corr: what. Here 'what' comes immediately after the verb 'do', so there's no noun to refer back to.
Corr: which. Here we need 'which' to refer back to a noun 'cottage'. We cannot use 'what' to refer to nouns.

sentence: could calculated the possibility of a failure.
remarks: Corr: which. Here we need 'which' to refer back to a noun 'program'. We cannot use 'what' to refer back to nouns.
